gurmukhi: jy jy bwid krq hMkwrw ] iqn qy iBMn rhq krqwrw ]
transliteration: Je Je Baadh Karat Hankaaraa|| Toon Te Bhinn Rahat Kartaaraa||
translation: Those who quarrel in ego, they are far removed from the Lord.

gurmukhi: byd kqyb ibKY hir nwhIN ] jwn lyhu hirjn mn mwhIN ]61]
transliteration: Bed Kateb Bikhai Har(i) Naahoon|| Jaan Leh(u) Harijan Man Maahoon||61||
translation: O men of God ! Understand this that the Lord doth not reside in Vedas and katebs. 61.

gurmukhi: AwNK mUMid koaU ifMB idKwvY ] AwNDr kI pdvI kih pwvY ]
transliteration: Aankh Moondd(i) Ko( i)  Dinbh Dikhaavai|| Aandhar Koo Padvoo Kah(i) Paavai||
translation: He, who exhibits heresy in closing his eyes, attains the state of blindness.

gurmukhi: AwNiK mIc mg sUJ n jweI ] qwih AnMq imlY ikm BweI ]62]
transliteration: Aankh(i) Moondh Mag Soojh Na Jaaoo|| Taah(i) Anant Milai Kim Bhaaoo||62||
translation: By closing the eyes one cannot know the path, how can then, O brother! He meet the Infinite Lord?62.

gurmukhi: bhu ibsQwr kh lau koeI khY ] smJq bwiq Qkq huAY rhY ]
transliteration: Bahu Bisthaar Kah Lau Ko( i)  Kahai|| Samjhat Baat(i) Thakat Huai Rahai||
translation: To what extent, the details be given? When one understands, he feels tired.

gurmukhi: rsnw DrY keI jo kotw ] qdip gnq iqh prq su qotw ]63]
transliteration: Rasnaa Ddarai Kaoo Jo Kotaa|| Tadap(i) Gadat Tih Parat Su Totaa||63||
translation: If one is blessed with millions of tongues, even then he feels them short in number, (while singing the Praises of the Lord)63.

gurmukhi: jb Awiesu pRB ko BXo; jnmu Drw jg Awie ]
transliteration: Jab Aais(u) Prabh Ko Bhayo Janam(u) Dharaa Jag Aae||
translation: When the Lord Willed, I was born on this earth.

gurmukhi: Ab mY kQw sMCyp qy; sBhMU khq sunwie ]1]
transliteration: Ab Mai Kathaa Sanchhep Te Sabh-hoon Kahat Sounne||64||
translation: Now I shall narrate briefly my own story.64.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk gRMQy mm AwigAw kwl jg p√çys krn nwm Kstmo iDAwie smwpq msqu suB msqu ]6] APjU ]279]
transliteration: It(i) Sroo Bachitra Naatak Granthe Mam Aagiaa Kaal Jag Praves Karan Naam Khastmo Dhiaae Samaapat Mast(u) Soubh Mast(u)||6||afjoo||279||
translation: End of the Sixth Chapter of BACHITTAR NATAK entitled The Command of Supreme KAL to Me for Coming into the World.6.279.
HERE BEGINS THE DESCRIPTION OF THE BIRTH OF THE POET.

gurmukhi: mur ipq pUrb kIXis pXwnw ] BwNiq BwNiq ky qIriQ nwnw ]
transliteration: Mur Pit Poorab Kooyas(i) Payaanaa|| Bhaant(i) Bhaant(i) Ke Toorah(i) Naanaa||
translation: My father proceeded towards the east and visited several places of pilgrimage.
